title: Revert error only shows in Verbose mode, only shows error code -32000
body:
- [ ] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue.

I did not ask in Gitter because this post contains a lengthy stack dump.

---------------------------

## Issue

When making a smart contract call the Ganache client throws a `revert` error.  The `revert` error does **not** show up in the transaction logs if VERBOSE MODE is turned _off_.  If you turn on VERBOSE mode then I get the following stack dump, with the only information given that of being the **error code: -32000**.

## Steps to Reproduce

- make a particular smart contract call.  In this case a public `view` contract call, _not_ a SEND transaction.

## Expected Behavior

The call should succeed or a reasonable `revert` error message should be produced by the Ganache client.  **Also, it would be great if errors like these _did_ show up in the transaction logs even if VERBOSE mode is turned _off_.**

## Actual Results

See above.

## Environment

* Operating System: _Ubuntu 18.04 (Bionic Beaver)_
* Ethereum client: _Ganache v 1.2.2_
* Truffle version (`truffle version`):
_Truffle v4.1.13 (core: 4.1.13)
Solidity v0.4.24 (solc-js)_
* node version (`node --version`): _v8.11.1_
* npm version (`npm --version`): _5.6.0_
